title: Outgoing smtp details being teset
creator: snowski
content:
snowski Sep 1, 2024, 18:50 CST

Emails were blocked from being sent out of Thunderbird. The solution was to change the smtp Outgoing settings, which works but only once: Telstra (email provider) recently upgraded it's security and the Outgoing Server details needed changing to "smtp.telstra.com" with Port 465, SSL/TLS, Normal Password, user name. The old default Outgoing Server was smtp.bigpond.com etc.

I deleted all the old Outgoing Server details and changed the old "smtp.bigpond.com" to "smtp.telstra.com" etc as the default. All was fine, emails could now be sent. The problem is that when Thunderbird is closed and reopened all the old smtp settings are being restored and the new SMTP settings removed/deleted. Emails now can't be sent again until the smtp settings are changed back to smtp.telstra.com etc. I've tried the advanced option and removed old smtp settings but that didn't work. Each time Thunderbird is closed the new Outgoing SMTP settings are overwritten by the old values. Is there somewhere on the C drive that I can access to delete the old settings manually or some other solution?
metadata: ;category:customize;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (iPhone; CPU iPhone OS 17_6_1 like Mac OS X) AppleWebKit/605.1.15 (KHTML, like Gecko) Version/17.6 Mobile/15E148 Safari/604.1;product:thunderbird

title: Setting local network server mail folder as Local Directory
creator: r.i.p1987
content:
I have used Thunderbird as my preferred mail client for many years. Recent upgrade to Kubuntu 24.04 from 22.04.4 seems to have changed storage options. Thunderbird 128.1.0esr(64bit)

I store my mail on my local server so that I can access it from a number of different computers on the same network. If I set the Local Directory to that network folder it is changed to /run/user/1000/doc/5f5f8977/mail.xxxxxx.com and the mail is imported to my local disk in that folder.

However, when I restart the computer I have to set up the network folder again each time.

I have never had this problem before. How do I set the Local Directory permanently to the network server address? Thanks Bob

title: Thunderbird login problem - 0x80004005 error message
creator: durkoandras
content: Hello. One e-mail account (online.de) in my Windows Mail, which has been operating continuously for three years, indicated a login password problem overnight last week. Since my mailbox was flawless on the web interface, I downloaded Thunderbirds. (I really like it so far). I logged into my two mailboxes (gmail, freemail) without any problems - but online.de also said after every setting: "Component returned failure code: 0x80004005 (NS_ERROR_FAILURE)" I tried to ask for help from the service provider for days, before they finally solved it their hands: they have no idea. In summary: online.de's web interface is flawless, Thunderbird's IMAP settings are fine, Thunderbird's other mailboxes are flawless. Can you help me what's going on???

title: Problemas ao colar imagem do whatsapp no corpo do email - Thunderbird
creator: user111053045295106468366157942782696683620
content:
Bom dia.

Recentemente nem eu nem nenhum dos usuários da empresa está conseguindo colar imagens copiadas do Whatsapp Web no corpo do email utilizando o Thunderbird, versão 128.1.1esr. Até semana passada isto era possível e utilizado amplamente dentro da empresa.

Sempre que uma imagem copiada do Whatsapp web é colada no corpo do email, é exibido um ícone como se o arquivo estivesse corrompido, em anexo um exemplo. O problema ocorre utilizando as 3 opções de colagem, "Colar", "Colar sem formatação" e "Colar como citação". Adicionalmente, imagens copiadas de outras fontes na internet, como por exemplo imagens do google ou imagens copiadas de quaisquer outros sites funcionam normalmente, bem como capturas de telas tiradas do computador, sendo inseridas no corpo do email ao utilizar a opção Colar (ctrl-v).

Apesar de parece pequeno, esse problema atrapalha muito o fluxo produtivo de todos da empresa, gostaria de ajuda para entender e solucionar esse incidente.

Desde já, agradeço a todos que colaborarem.
metadata: ;category:troubleshooting;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:129.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/129.0;product:thunderbird

title: After update to Thunderbird version 128:  Quick filter freezes the GUI while doing the filtering
creator: matthias.merkel
content:
Dear community, I have recently updated my Thinkpad from kubuntu 22.04 to 24.04, which included an update of thunderbird to version 128.1.0esr (and a switch to a snap package).

However, when I type into the quick filter bar, (i) the whole thunderbird GUI freezes until the filter was applied to my several thousand emails, (ii) which also seems to take much longer than before. Before the update, the filter took maybe ~0.5 seconds or less, it now takes ~4 seconds. A lot for just a few thousand emails. Btw, the same happens if I empty the quick filter field. Just that it seems to take now even longer until it shows all of my emails.

I don't know if anyone can help. I feel more this could be something for a bug report?

Thanks a lot in advance, Matthias
metadata: ;category:troubleshooting;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Ubuntu; Linux x86_64; rv:129.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/129.0;product:thunderbird;solver_id:6148365

title: Non visualizzo il testo delle emails scaricate da settimane e mesi con TB!!!
creator: giovanni.ben
content: Buon pomeriggio, ho provato a cercare nel Forum ma trovo solo domande analoghe e non riesco a capire le risposte quali siano, quindi spero che possiate rispondere anche a me. Da agosto noto che le emails scaricate non sono più leggibili nel loro testo, si vede solo l'oggetto, si vede se ci sono allegati (la spilla) ma non si legge nulla e non sembrano neanche esistere se ci clikko sopra col mouse. Questo anche per le emails inviate o cancellate. Sembra ci sia solo la loro traccia ma non la sostanza e per chi come me usa TB per lavoro è assolutamente un grave problema. Inoltre ho notato che questo problema vale a posteriori avendo coinvolto emails precedenti che prima leggevo! sono disperato!!!! Utilizzo TB da oltre 10 anni e lo aggiorno sempre (ora uso 128.1.1esr (32 bit) ). cosa succede? avete una soluzione? da una decina di giorni o meno le nuove emails scaricate si leggono normalmente ma quelle vecchie di 2.3 settimane ed oltre sembrano scomparse. grazie Giovanni

title: Calendar Reminders unreadable, too dark
creator: sivarik
content:
Hi,

The uploaded image shows the problem. When I first open Tbird and the Reminder popup opens, all reminders look normal - black text on a white background. As soon as I do anything, in Tbird or another application, the top reminder gets a very dark blue background, making it unreadable.

This has been going on since the release before 128 (124?). I waited until the next release in case it was just 124. Clearly, it isn't. I have opened Tbird in Troubleshoot mode but the issue remains.

The only possibility I can think of is that I have too many emails. That's a very long, unrealistic guess so any others would be greatly appreciated!

Thanks, sivarik

title: Unified Folders Slow on MacOS 128.1.1
creator: elijah.sauder
content:
Hello,

I've recently begun using Thunderbird to manage all of my disparate email accounts. Going into each account separately was a bit slower than ideal so I found out about Unified folders. However, I run into an issue with the main Inbox where clicking on it will freeze Thunderbird for up to several minutes. I know there are other posts about this, however, nothing has been able to fix the issues I have so far (also a lot of them are on windows).

Issue: Clicking on "Inbox" in the "Unified Folders" section results in a freezing of the software for period of time (it does eventually unfreeze). The freeze is preceded by a noticeable albeit reasonably short pause as Thunderbird switches to the inbox. After this is when the freeze happens and it shows as not responding in Activity Monitor.

Things that don't cause the issue: - Clicking on any of the account specific inbox folders within the "Unified Folders" menu. - Clicking on an account's inbox.

Current setup: Accounts: - My proton mail account ( - My google mail account (only downloads the last year of mail for offline access) (total mail in the 10s of thousands range)

Things I have tried: - Launching in trouble shooting mode - Launching in trouble shooting mode while disabling plugins and such - Delete global sqlite db - Delete imap msr files - Fully re install and re-setup accounts
metadata: ;category:troubleshooting;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/128.0.0.0 Safari/537.36;product:thunderbird

title: Thunderbird local directory changes after restart
creator: rapo60
content:
Hi,

since I installed Ubuntu 24.04 Thunderbird (V. 128.1.0 as snap app) changes the path of the local directory each time I restart Thunderbird. My original path to the local directory points to a mounted drive e.g. /media/username/disk... Thunderbird changes it to /run/usr/1000/doc/.... How can I avoid this? The same thing happens also to the path of the signature file.

Thank you for your help! Ubuntu
